title: Ensure log levels are appropriately padded even on coloured outputs.
body:
Hi,

First of all thanks for the library.

There was an issue when having colored output on Linux(Manjaro Linux with KDE to be specific), where coloured outputs had mis-padded logging

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24320659/194759222-dec040f8-924a-4ef6-a021-2f28e61ca1e4.png)


The issue came about with how coloring is done on Linux, i.e we add special characters in the command line, e.g printing color red would add `\033[39m`,

Later on, when you tried to format the message with appropriate padding, for log levels

```rust
            let message = format!(
                "{}{:<5} [{}{}] {}",
                timestamp,
                level_string,
                target,...);
```

The colored log levels would not be padded because the string is  longer than 5 characters, hence the misalignment above.

The fix was to simply do the padding before the coloring which fixes that misalignment,
now with this pr the printed output looks like

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24320659/194759536-83663703-982e-4962-a239-17e2a5209fd5.png)

This is now in tandem with the no color output which would print with the appropriate padding

Hope it helps.

title: Adopt windows-sys
body:
On Windows, since winapi [winapi](https://github.com/retep998/winapi-rs) is not maintained anymore and microsfot has an official api for internal links, I think it's a good idea to switch to this api [Windows API](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/).

What do you think about it ?

title: Using the FromStr implementation for LevelFilter, also fixes #64
body:
There's already a FromStr implementation for LevelFilter that perfectly fits this use case.

Tests pass.

title: Include UTC offset when using `Timestamps::UtcOffset`
body: fix #61

title: doc: call env after with_level
body: I had some trouble with calling the `env` method _before_ the `with_level` method, since I presumed this worked like other builder structs where the order of arguments didn't really matter.

title: improve documentation
body:
- [x] Improve readme Markdown code block syntax highlighting
- [x] Fix documentation typos

labels.name: CVE-2020-26235
labels.description: Unsound behaviour with local timezone access

title: upgrade to colored 2.0
body:
The 2.0 release of colored has only a minor API change that doesn't
affect its usage in this crate:
https://github.com/mackwic/colored/blob/v2.0.0/CHANGELOG.md

title: Add options to use UTC timestamps
body:
This sidesteps issues users are having when using local times in
conditions where the `time` crate cannot safely get the local time.

Thanks to @uggla and @rye.

title: Try to fix accidentally disabled default timestamps feature
body:
Hi!
I have noticed that after commits, which replaces `chrono` dependency with `time`, logger does not print timestamps by default.

In this https://github.com/borntyping/rust-simple_logger/blob/main/src/lib.rs#L37 line, `chrono` feature-gate was used before dependency changes. Now it is `timestamps`.
 
So I just try to actualize default feature gates in project manifest.

title: Exchanged `chrono` Dependency for Equal Implementation Using The Still-Maintained `time` Crate
body:
The reason for this pull request is the recent security advisory, [RUSTSEC-2020-0159](https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2020-0159). This issue detected a potential segfault in `localtime_r` invocations, and given the `chrono` crate's lack of maintenance, the `time` crate, which fixed the issue, is now the preferred crate for datetime offsets and formatting.

The format used is still identical to the one achieved via `chrono`, but this implementation also prevents the issues caused by RUSTSEC-2020-0159, which were failing CI/CL actions in many repositories dependent upon `rust-simple_logger`.

The changes should still work in a no_alloc, no_std situation as expected.

(note: yes I see that I did a typo and put RUSTSEC-2021 instead of RUSTSEC-2020 in the commit. oops)

title: Add some documentation bits to the 'stderr' feature
body: I've forgotten to add docs, please merge with the next release

title: Use a 'stderr' feature to target log output to stderr
body: Low hanging fruit to address #21. Usually it is ok to decide at compile time where log output shall go.

title: s/chrono/colored
body: Closes: #35

title: Add an option to control whether timestamps are to be printed or not.
body:
Timestamps are useful when debugging, but when the program is executed from systemd, journald automatically adds timestamps to the lines, so one gets duplicate timestamps.

This adds an option to turn timestamps off without having to recompile with a different feature set.

title: Add semicolon which caused compilation errors
body: The provided example didn't compile because of the missing semicolon.

title: Add SimpleLogger::from_env_or
body: I want to set the default log level to INFO instead of ERROR, but I can't currently do that if I initialize SimpleLogger using `from_env`.  I added a new function, `from_env_or`, that lets me override the default log level.

title: Adding the hability to choose wich feature to enable
body: Since https://github.com/borntyping/rust-simple_logger/pull/10 is possible to disable colorized output **and** timestamps, with this new addition it will be possible to choose disabling one while still keeping the other one.

title: Revert deprecation of stand-alone initialisation functions
body:
These functions provide a very pleasant shortcut in the minimalist spirit of this crate.

For more advanced usages, the builder pattern is still available.

title: Update links in README.md
body:
- Add link to documentation (Closes: #22)
- Remove Travis CI since not used anymore

title: Match all submodules on `with_module_level`
body:
Added a test, just to be sure.

Also some examples were missing a `unwrap()` after calling `init()`, fixed that too.

Closes #24.

----

I'm unsure about `with_target_levels`, since that takes a `HashMap` and we don't use that anymore (for now). Changing this is a bit tricky due to backwards compatibility. I think I could modify this into something that take an `impl IntoIterator<(String, LevelFilter)>` or the like so that the actual data structure is hidden as an implementation detail. Also I'm not sure about the semantics of that method, why does it overwrite all existing level filters instead of adding them? Can I change this or is this considered a breaking change? (@creekorful you wrote this, any opinions?)

title: Added in use statement for usage example.
Add #[must_use] to builder methods
body:
No worries if you don't want to take this, but was easier to write the PR than to open a discussion issue.


This will warn the user if they do not call the init() method.

This patch also tweaks the docs in a few places to highlight the
need to call init.

This was motiviated because I failed to do this myself when moving
to the new API, and had a confused couple minutes :)

- reference: https://github.com/linebender/druid/pull/1218
- closes #23

title: Implement builder pattern
body:
Hello @borntyping this PR implements the builder pattern to instantiate the logger & rework the selective logging feature. (implementation idea by @piegamesde)

Do you want me to increment minor version (no breaking change introduce) on this PR?

Don't hesitate to correct me If there's a better way, or if you have better ideas.

title: Allow to log only on specific log targets
body:
This PR should allow to log only on specific log targets thus preventing any non-wanted spamming from dependencies.

Closes: #15

title: Migrate to github actions
body:
The jobs run `clippy` and `rustfmt` checks, as well as `cargo test`.
There is also a job to publish the crate. You only need to add `CRATES_TOKEN`, which is an API token from [`crates.io`](https://crates.io) to the repo secrets.
After that, to test and publish the crate run this in the local repo on the latest checkout of `master`:
```
git tag v1.0.0
git push --tags
```

title: Migrate to edition = "2018"
body: Migrating to new edition is always backwards-compatible https://doc.rust-lang.org/edition-guide/editions/index.html#compatibility

title: Init by env fn
body: This is another version of #12 , the only difference is that this one uses a function instead of a macro.

title: macro init-by-env
body: A macro for simulating env_logger behavior, which enables the user to choose log level by setting a `RUST_LOG` environment variable.

title: Add 'chrono' compile time option
body:
Disabling this feature removes the timestamp from the log output. This is
useful when the log output is sent to a logging gatherer which already does its
own timestamping (such as journald).

Addresses https://github.com/borntyping/rust-simple_logger/issues/9
